history.text: Hi
hi
This movie looks really good, do you like funny movies
Sure. But what kind of funny?
Comedy, Adventure and Animation
so it's an animated comedy?
Yes, the name of the movie is Zootopia, it premiered in 2016.
Is it about a zoo? BAsed on the title...?
No, but you are close!  It's about a world with talking mammals instead of human life.
Hmmm, I do enjoy animals that can talk... :)
Zootopia is the name of the big city it is set in.  Yes, me too!
So what kind of adventures do these talking mammals get into?
The main character is a talking bunny who finished as valedictorian at the Academy but instead of front line police action, she gets parking duty!
And if it's not in the zoo, why the name? Are they zoo animals?
That's just what they called the city they all live in.  There is a red fox who is a con artist, and Idris Elba plays the Water Buffalo police chief.
So the bunny, the fox, and the water buffalo are the main characters?
Yes, there's also a diminutive sheep that is the assistant mayor of Zootopia.

Okay, so what is the plotline of the movie? what are
 all of these animals doing?

Well the con artist red fox also has a partner in crime, another red fox.  He hustles the rabbit (Judy) on her first day at the police department.  She figures out he is a suspect in another crime and tricks him into confessing to tax evasion.
Then there are different high crime scenes with some of the animals going savage.
What do you mean by "going savage"?
They revert to a feral state.
Are there any human characters in this movie?

No, just voiceovers for the animated characters.  Anyhow, tudy the new police woman/rabbit is trying to solve a case and uses the city's traffic cameras to find out that wolves have captured and carried off a missing 
chauffer.
Sorry, Judy not tudy
That's okay. I understood what you meant
Judy finds out that the mayor, whose name is Lionheart is keeping the animals that went savage as hostages imprisoned in a place called Cliffside Asylum.
so who is the protagonist in the movie? presumably the bunny who did well in school and got put on parking duty?
Yes.  The mayor is the bad guy it turns out, he gets arrested for keeping the feral animals prisoners.  The diminutive sheep moves up to the mayor spot.
So Judy quits the police force over some comments she made at a press conference that caused an uproar in the city.
Hmmm, sounds a lot like real life
Yes.  I'm not doing it justice, it is a very well crafted plot, you have got to see it to follow it.
I'm definitely intrigued
There's a finale it looks like at the Natural History Museum.  Mentions a prey-supremacist conspiracy.
Thanks for telling me about it
You're welcome.  It looks like the protagonist is a guy named Bellwether.
That;s very interesting..
I imagine I will check it out.

uid2response.feedback: The plotline and talking animated mammals sound interesting to me. I like that the littlest animal is seemingly the protagonist.
